definition: permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)

sentences.english: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
sentences.chinese: 都恒心遵守使徒的教训，彼此交接，擘饼，祈祷。

sentences.english: However Xia Hong was extraordinary constantly and said failure is the mother of success.
sentences.chinese: 然而夏红非常有恒心，她说失败是成功的妈妈。

sentences.english: It doesn’t always work, but good things often come to those who are persistent.
sentences.chinese: 这并不总是有效，但好事总是垂青那些有恒心的人。

sentences.english: That was when I realized that being a sister requires patience and persistence.
sentences.chinese: 我那时才意识到作为一个姐姐需要耐心和恒心。

sentences.english: With perseverance you will definitely catch him.
sentences.chinese: 你有恒心就一定抓得住他。

sentences.english: The mother attributed her son's failure to lack of persistence.
sentences.chinese: 这位亲认为她儿子的失败是由于缺乏恒心。

sentences.english: With commitment, research and patience, the means will come.
sentences.chinese: 只要有恒心，研究和耐心，你会自然而然找到途径。

sentences.english: Hope that all the English teacher kalk with English on computer.
sentences.chinese: 决心和恒心撼动世界希望我们英语教师多用英语交流。

sentences.english: Your patience and effort will pay off in a lifetime of better health.
sentences.chinese: 你的恒心和努力会为你赢得一生的健康体魄。

sentences.english: Persist in whatever you do and do not change your aspirations at will.
sentences.chinese: 做事要有恒心，所立定的志向不要随意更改。

sentences.english: Only the person with perseverance and willpower can be successful.
sentences.chinese: 有恒心，有毅力，方能成功。

sentences.english: If you wish to succeed, you should use persistence as your good friend.
sentences.chinese: 当你希望成功，当以恒心为良友。

sentences.english: Adhere to your weight loss in a process of demand persistence and perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 减肥贵在一个坚持的进程，需求有恒心和毅力。

sentences.english: Jacob prevailed because he was persevering and determined.
sentences.chinese: 雅各的得胜是因为他有恒心和决心。

definition: to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
